name: assembly-tolly
description: AssEmbly syntax highlighting and other language features

assembly-tolly.linting.linterPath.description: The path to the AssEmbly executable that will provide source code linting. Default requires the executable to be on PATH.

assembly-tolly.linting.baseFileOverride.description: The path to use as the base file when linting. By default the currently open file is used.

assembly-tolly.linting.macroLimit.description: The maximum number of macro expansions that can occur on a single line when linting.

assembly-tolly.linting.whileRepeatLimit.description: The maximum number of %WHILE repetitions that can occur throughout the entire linting assembly process.

assembly-tolly.linting.variableDefines.description: A map of assembler variables to define when linting.
assembly-tolly.linting.variableDefines.format: An object of {string: integer} to map the name of the variable to its value.

assembly-tolly.linting.enableObsoleteDir.description: Enable the use of replaced assembler directives (e.g. DAT, IMP, MAC instead of %DAT, %IMP, %MACRO) within the program when linting. Ensures compatibility with programs written for versions prior to 3.2.0.

assembly-tolly.linting.disableVariableEx.description: Disable the expansion of assembler variables and constants within the program when linting. Ensures compatibility with programs written for versions prior to 3.2.0.

assembly-tolly.linting.disableEscapeSequ.description: Disable the use of escape sequences in strings when linting. Ensures compatibility with programs written for versions prior to 1.1.0.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
